entry.content:
Each breath a painting of creation
A possibility held for not so long,
A form in disintegration
Losing what was once held strong.

Each moment, and broader yet
your life and work
an arising and passing away.
'You' the moment in between --
saying what only "you" can say.

One such flower in all the world
One such pattern to witness
Never again can it be the same.
Once less than a flicker
Once more than a name
Human
You.

entry.content:
A half-held dream woke me tonight,
In the hour whence I lay my head.
The thought of you below conscious waters:
fantastic confusion, sparkled--
glimmered in delight.

I took fright --
For who could plant such thoughts
deep into the soil of my mind?

In my head are words that I never spoke;
In my heart is a picture that I never painted;
In the world you are a fading light:
the memory of a distant knock
on a dusty door --
in other words
you breathe no more.

entry.content:
More tender a moment
the more is the craft
of the gift of words
your mind must amass

Carefully ponder each word you will speak,
because what she hears could seem
hurting and bleak.

The moment the gift of knowing unwrapped
you can be assured that there's no turning back

Make your intention and meaning quite clear
for a phrase without context is blurry,
and her mind may be worried --
filled with things that she fears.

A domino toppled can make a world to dust.
Speak soon, but not too much.
Say what's necessary and let it be,
now wait and see
for whether or not you'll be understood
is better to know
than to live with a splinter
in the chamber of your soul.

entry.content:
Be a child,
a playful one
pull your face,
Look the fun
worry not what others think,
throw those thoughts down at the door,
ask the moment
and it gives more.

Whisper in my ear,
the feelings which you fear:
those moments lost to youth,
those one's you've let slip past.

Tell me dear, truly speak
Let me see you as you are,
drop all facade and paint to floor,
and show me what you hid before.

Show me pictures, and tell me tales,
the sentimental,
the little things:
the defining walls of your heart
What's your foundation?
Where did it start?

Walk with me in silent tones
going deep to leave behind
conventional heart and mind.

Let painting become painter and
you the canvas for its story.
What spectrums do you feel?

Forget responses conditioned,
present me with your moment:
where I dance with you,
dressed in what you are
not in what you think you have to be.

entry.content:
Disappear with me into a moment shared
where we lose ourselves and find our in-between,
where written words paint
the rhythms of our breathing.

Let slip. Let go;
what you thought we were
as this moment becomes the only thing worth caring for.

Slowly, surely, creeping,
I see from your eyes seeping
the conscious thought and filter
that hinder our taste of life.

In the seconds after
there we lay --
the early hours of the next day,
with talk and kiss and cuddle
filling the distance of our difference.

A hope or thought or feeling
that 'us' will always be:
a wish that's more than human
in the world of memory.

entry.content:
When bit, you're taken -
yes you're took
seeking worlds beyond you known
watching, walking seeing things:
foreign, different, interesting.
people, faces, culture,
houses, streets and structure.

Travel now fills your veins,
another expression of need for change.
Enjoy my child if you can,
enjoy my child if you may.
for they say...
one day you'll be looking back
and counting these among your best.

But if it never comes to be
that this vast world you hear or see
Then at the least remember this:
Be the young one,
the curious heart
'cos heart and home will surely part -
Let awe-filled moments
keep your smile,
keep you sane,
make you silly
and loving -
these things they now call vain.

entry.content:
Ah yes oh clock of life you tick,
with wisdom deep at hour's mark,
Or as the wave begins to wane
The deep cut hurting, also the same.

How interesting the times between:
a you rope walking two extremes
two moments defining your being
two moments:
one yet unknown

How can you say that you know
where your path in life
will have you go
and if it does,
as you please,
then tell me truly did it appease?

But what if when you least expect
a storm creeps right to your shore.
Your wit and smarts matched against
its rolling roar.
Admit the truth and let it be:
your plans now cast in uncertainty

Thus I say, friend or foe:
hold on to life, but not too tight.
Hold it gently like a hatchling owl
keeping enough space for it to breathe.

For as you tense your grip on life
you only haul the noose
around your neck.

entry.content:
What to feel in a 'great' this deep,
questions come by thoughts that seep,
miles into the fibres of my life,
questioning purpose,
questioning essence,
questioning life.

How odd the fact that what I wonder seems to be
aeons away,
years apart from my mind.
I'm the idiot, the fool, the knave.
The one I've been calling out all along.

Answers none, describe the pain
felt in a place where I shall reap,
each single thought played on repeat,
each single judgement I have made.
Each one becomes another wall -
an obstacle to overcome.
Each understanding - a partial truth
each belief - a biased drive.

It keeps to seem that the words of others carry sense more than my own.
How sad a life lived in this way, where self distrust is all your day?
Where the mirror speaks of your true self:
The one you wish to be -
different,
better.
The one that is the harmony
of a flooding river faced with a tree
roaring past as you watch
with a feeling in heart
that words can't touch.
Seeing its gracefully violent nature
as the answer
to existence
itself.

entry.content:
On levels impossible I try to relate,
looking for keys to the overgrown gate,
digging for times right on the brim:
moments dripping, lost at whim.

My grasping hands try to keep,
each passing second from slipping beyond.

Yet as I sit upon this beach, my past is far
and out of reach:
shadows and smoke too fleeting to hold
The fickle candle but lighting the floor
of this tiny space
I now call home.

entry.content:
The chilly winter breeze,
speaks to me tonight.
The sun's last caress of the mountain's cheek,
Red pink purple -- gone.
Rustling leaves - the last protest.
Moments - these, my happiness.

Speak wind. I will hear your
whispers from the trees.

Far and near: no silence yet, as dogs protest
foreign man or beast
which strayed past his home.

Lay to rest your qualms, your dissatisfaction.
Let be the moment you're in.
Be with it: fears, tears, love and sin.

entry.content: And as we consume our meals of ignorance: breakfast, lunch, dinner, snack, we deny their existence even as we peek the shadow of that gnawing feeling they create. We say aloud in our mind, as if to drown that feeling: "It's ok, it isn't what it really is, this is an exception to the rule, the rational rule. Calm, don't fret, it's but one transgression". And thus one becomes many, finally we find ourselves in the present filled with regret, asking how it all happened. It's obvious how it happened, but probably not to you.

entry.content:
Hello November, you caught me by surprise.

Moments ago I was a boy --
Now I’m faced with the reality
of another year’s memory.

The vast ocean of feelings,
The waves of thought,
The currents of temptation,
The rock solid reality.

In retrospect all things reveal their spectre,
few things are beyond reason,
but looking ahead, an uncertain future awaits.

As the flower blossoms from the peeking sun, it holds no expectation.
As time dances upon the strings of reality
how to regret a note in this melody?
how to regret a human moment?
